reviews.review: This "movie" is a certified cringefest that makes The Star Wars Holiday Special look like The Empire Strikes Back. Worst Star Wars movie ever. Yes The Rise Of Skywalker is even worse than both The Force Awakens and The Last Jedi combined. RIP Star Wars.

This movie begins with a rocky start. The cuts between scenes were disjointed and and the camera shots were too quick, leading to a lack of depth and quality dialogue. It felt like the crew thought viewers have short attention spans and can't focus on the same shot for more than 2 seconds. 

After about an hour of heavy exposition, the movie being to pick up. While the middle of the movie was far from perfect, there were some truly perfect scenes that elevated the rest of the movie. For instance, the dynamic between Finn and Poe was charming and hilarious, giving viewers some much needed breaks between the vast majority of dark and tense scenes in this movie. There are also some long awaited conversations that happen that feel so satisfying to watch. 

I didn't like the main plot which felt dull, consisting of finding a person, who leads them to an object, which leads them to another person, who leads them to someone else, etc...But, I did enjoy the subplot between Kylo Ren and Rey. Adam and Daisy always give a phenomenal performance that captures the viewer's attention. The scenes between them were objectively the best in the movie and deserved more narrative attention. 

What bothers me most about movie was what a let down the ending is. I actually enjoyed the middle of the movie and was feeling good about where the story was going. But what happened at the end caught me off guard and was needlessly depressing. It conflicted with the hopeful title of the movie and was tonally all wrong. It pains me to say, but the last scene in the movie felt like a middle finger to the whole Skywalker saga. I left wondering, what was even the point of the last 42 years of Star Wars movies?
This was so much better than I expected. Definitely a breath of fresh air.  Glad they brought it back from the brink.
the best out of the trilogy.....

Extremely rushed the first half of the movie. The second half of the movie was filled with a bunch of stretches that were convenient to the plot. Also feel the movie just side stepped the OT characters to prop up Disneys new characters. Jokes fell flat and made the movie corny.
This is much better than Last Jedi.
It try's to hard to over come the failings of the Last Jedi and over use of force power and 1 liner's that fall short of being funny would kill the mood in that given scene

This was a great movie. A lot of fun & tied everything together (for the most part). Great action & character moments. Funny when it needed to be & heartfelt in some genuine ways. All in the midst of hard core Star Wars lore playing out in the background. Good for the casual fan & the person deep into this world. Get over it if you thought it should go a different way. There were many ways to end this series, but this one was great with some surprising & fun action along the way.
wow the rumors were true this movie is as bad as they said, save your money and wait for it to be free on disney+
A love letter to Star Wars fans
